A 'community of circumstance' is similar to a community of practice, except that
it is driven by position, circumstance or life experiences rather than a shared
interest. Marsh G. The community of circumstanceâa tale of three cities:
community participation in St Kilda, Knox, and Lewisham. In: Chekki DA, ed.
Research in community sociology. Vol 9. Varieties of community sociology.
Greenwich, CT: Jai Press, 1999, pp. 65â88. Examples might include cancer
sufferers using a support newsgroup or the members of gay/lesbian newsgroups. A
Prison or other correctional facility can be thought of as a community of
circumstance; passengers of the same plane form a temporary community of
circumstance as well.
